verb.description: Modify (a painting or color) by applying a very thin coat of opaque paint to give a softer or duller effect.
examples: the area surrounding the main figures will be scumbled

noun.description: A thin, opaque coat of paint or layer of shading applied to give a softer or duller effect.

origin: Late 17th century (as a verb): perhaps a frequentative of the verb scum.
